Articles.Content: Does anyone know what will happen to the B9 aerospace mod after the 30th May?

B9 is CC-BY-NC-SA, so people can freely pass it around and/or rehost if needed. Not sure if NC precludes it being rehosted on Curse by someone other than bac9, though.

E: Also, a rehoster may not have permission to redistribute the Firespitter dll, so that is something to look out for.

Edited May 16, 2014 by regex

B9 is CC-BY-NC-SA, so people can freely pass it around and/or rehost if needed. Not sure if NC precludes it being rehosted on Curse by someone other than bac9, though.

E: Also, a rehoster may not have permission to redistribute the Firespitter dll, so that is something to look out for.

Might be time for someone to adopt it (purely for compatibility updates) until B9 returns to it/it gets replaced by new packs. CC-BY-NC-SA allows for adaptations to be made and released aslong as attribution remains iirc
Bac9 isn't gone though, as a matter of fact he's online on IRC right now.

Does anyone know what will happen to the B9 aerospace mod after the 30th May?

B9 has a alternate mediafire mirror.

Bac9 isn't gone though, as a matter of fact he's online on IRC right now.

He hasn't however updated B9 in a few months, it requires a couple of community fixes to work atm bundling them in with B9 and putting it up should be fine under the license.

I have a feeling it'll be updated: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79611-B9-Aerospace-interim-maintenance-pack?p=1153310&viewfull=1#post1153310
